ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Have you ever thought about why spatial and temporal scale is, or should be, one of the single most relevant questions in the study of ecology? Here, this class will tell you why. Would definitely recommend. The class was great and more students would have definitely improved the experience.
Yes, but be prepared to be completely lost and figure out what you're reading.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Overall came out with a slightly reduced fear of reading papers focused on ecological theory. Also came out with a pet theory to attach to my current research. The class not only broadened my knowledge of ecology (especially in those dark theoretical corners I typically avoid), but also sparked a genuine interest in the theoretical (abstract) underpinnings of ecological patterns.
